events.title: Virginia Dare Born
events.description: Virginia Dare becomes the first English child born in the Americas, in the Roanoke Colony, present-day North Carolina.
events.significance: Her birth symbolizes early English attempts at colonization in the New World.

events.title: 19th Amendment Ratified
events.description: The 19th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, granting women the right to vote, is ratified on August 18, 1920.
events.significance: A major milestone in women's suffrage and civil rights in the United States.

events.title: Winston Churchill Makes 'Never Surrender' Speech
events.description: British Prime Minister Winston Churchill delivers a speech to the House of Commons rejecting any surrender to Nazi Germany during World War II.
events.significance: Boosted British morale during the Battle of Britain.

events.title: Bahrain National Independence Day
events.description: Bahrain celebrates its independence from British colonial rule on August 18, 1963.
events.significance: Marked the sovereignty and self-governance of Bahrain as a nation.

events.title: First GPS Satellite Launched
events.description: The first GPS (Global Positioning System) satellite, Navstar 1, is launched into orbit by the United States.
events.significance: Paved the way for the modern global navigation and positioning system.
